subclassFeature.name: Grief Domain
entries: Clerics of the grief domain carry a heavy weight with them and choose to help others carry their own. To them, grief is the primary modality through which we grow. It is the lifeblood of progress. These clerics can control grief to both heal and harm, releasing a person from its icy grasp or using unresolved pain to stop them in their tracks. They make formidable agents for their causes, as they do not fear loss. Why fear that which is inevitable?

subclassFeature.name: Emotional Support
entries: At first level, you gain proficiency with heavy armor. you also learn the {@spell guidance} cantrip, which doesn't count against the number of cleric cantrips you know. You can cast it as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Wrestle with Grief
entries: At 1st level, you gain the ability to bring wounds of loss to the forefront of a creature's mind. When you make an {@skill Athletics} check for the purposes of {@action Grapple|PHB|grappling} a creature, you can add your proficiency bonus twice instead of your normal bonus, and you use your Wisdom modifier instead of Strength.

While a creature is {@condition grappled} by you, you can use a bonus action on your turn to make a melee spell attack roll against it. On a hit, you deal {@dice 1d8} cold or psychic damage. The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level {@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Griefstruck
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to cause a creature recall a deep unprocessed grief. As an action, you choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion}. On a success, all conditions and curses on the creature end.

subclassFeature.name: Shared Burden
entries: At 6th level, you gain the ability to take on some of the suffering of those you love. When you finish a long rest, choose another creature you can see. The creature gains +1 to AC and saving throws. It also gains resistance to all damage. Any damage it takes, you take also. This effect lasts until you choose a different creature, or if you and the creature are no longer on the same plane of existence.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Strike
entries: At 8th level, you gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with divine energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can use the attack to deal an extra {@dice 1d8} cold or psychic damage to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to {@dice 2d8}.

subclassFeature.name: Patron Saint of Those Who Grieve
entries: At 17th level, your intimate familiarity with grief reaches its apex.

items: You gain resistance to cold and psychic damage.
When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to take the damage instead.
